channel.title: Rnaseq on Biocozy.net
channel.description: Recent content in Rnaseq on Biocozy.net

item.title: rRNA genes in the human genome
item.description: Larry Moran has an excellent discussion of the organization of rRNA genes in the human genome. It’s an old post, but a good one. If you’re involved in RNA-Seq, you should read it. Dr. Moran’s discussion makes it clear why it is necessary to map reads to a synthetic rRNA-ome before doing full-genome alignment – if you want to accurately count, or filter out, rRNA reads (which can predominate in RNA-seq datasets).
